intro: Antinoria, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, primarily native to South America, with some species found in Africa and Asia. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and showy, yellow or orange composite flower heads. They typically grow in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and disturbed soils. Antinoria species are often used in traditional medicine and have ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
